title.rendered: Jersey vs UAE, World Cup Qualifiers 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team on basis of probable XIs, recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Jersey: Harrison Carlyon, Nick Greenwood, Josh Lawrenson, Asa Tribe, Jake Dunford (wk), Dominic Blampied, Jonty Jenner,  Benjamin Ward, Julius Sumerauer, Charles Perchard (c), Elliot Miles

UAE: Aryan Lakra, Muhammad Waseem (c), Vriitya Aravind (wk), Rameez Shahzad, Asif Khan, Rohan Mustafa, Aayan Afzal Khan, Karthik Meiyappan, Sanchit Sharma, Junaid Siddique, Zahoor Khan

Also Read:

Delhi vs Gujarat Fantasy Tips

Pitch Report

Venue: Wanderers Cricket Ground, Windhoek

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 252

2nd innings average score: 178

Wickets per innings: 8

Type: Good for spin

Wins

Batting 1st: 33%

Batting 2nd: 67%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Rohan Mustafa featured in the Best11 in four consecutive ODIs, scoring 87 runs at 29, taking four wickets, and grabbing two catches.

Between them in the series, Asif Khan and Muhammad Waseem have scored 415 runs at a combined average of 52 including bonus points for 48 boundaries. Waseem has also provided handy points for five catches.

With the help of seven wickets and 94 runs, Aayan Afzal Khan has produced the most fantasy points (329) for the UAE in the Qualifiers.

Asa Tribe was a power player in the Best11 in the last two games, scoring 115* and 75.

For Jersey, Charles Perchard and Julius Sumerauer have taken the bulk of the wicket (14). Sumerauer has also scored 74 runs at 24 down the order.

Benjamin Ward has done it all for Jersey in the series thus far: six wickets, a top score of 46 in a tough situation, and three catches.

Zahoor Khan has generated an average of 50 points per game, taking eight wickets (the most for the UAE) in four games.

In the last three games at the venue, spinners accounted for 50% of the wickets.
